Text: Who's this?

As a senior bunny girl, I'm responsible for my
subordinate's mistakes. So will you kindly allow
me to participate as well?

I don't recall this bunny girl in our staff roster...
Forget it. I can't afford to mess up in front of King.
(This woman... What is she playing at?!)
...Very well. The more the merrier.

If you'll excuse us for a moment. We'll make the
necessary preparations and meet up again later.
...What do you think you're doing?

Nothing. I saw an opportunity for a staff member like
myself to join in a game, so I took it. That's all.

...Just to clarify, have you ever gambled at a casino
before?

Of course not. This is my first time stepping into
one.
But don't worry. I sort of get how the rules work.

...Sort of? You'll just hold me back at this rate.
Honestly, I didn't think you were this impulsive...

What's the big deal? I only joined mid conversation,
but it didn't seem like you were in a position to turn
down participating.
W-Well...

I get to join in the games, and you get a reassuring
ally. Sounds like a win-win situation to me.

Not sure about "reassuring," but I guess you're
right. Stillâ€”
Jeez, c'mon. It's already decided. Just accept it.

Anyway, the fact is I couldn't just stand by while
you were in trouble. I mean, we're comrades who
promised to help each other.

I'm sorry if I didn't go about it in the smoothest
way, but...

If there's reason behind your actions, why don't you
let me help?
Princess Alexia...
...Fine. Just try not to hold me back.
Sure, you just tell yourself that.
Right back at you.

By the way, you're on your own if we lose, okay?
I'm only here for support.
Y-You petty princess... You just want to gamble...!

Thank you for your patience. The game event will
momentarily commence.
Are you two bunny girls ready?
...Yes, we're ready.

Very well. Here are the rules: we'll play a maximum
of three games, with the victor being whoever wins
best out of two.

The first game is Blackjack. The match will take
place between the dealer and the player.

You'll play a total of 11 rounds. You must win six or
more out of 11 to win the match. Are we clear?
Blackjack...huh? Very well. We accept.

Blackjack...? C-Could you explain the rules, just in
case...?

...Are you telling me you don't know? I thought you
said you sort of get how the rules work...

*sigh* Well, we're off to a good start. Dealer, could
you please explain the rules to her?

Of course, and by the way, I will be your dealer for
this match.

To put it simply, the player whose hand is closest to
21 wins.

Cards 2 through 10 are worth their face value, and
face cards are worth 10. The ace is a powerful card
worth either 1 or 11.

At any rate, whoever's hand is either 21 exactly or
closest to 21 wins. It's a draw if the values are the
same.

One thing to keep in mind is that if the total of
your hand exceeds 22, you bust and lose. As for me,
the dealer, I must keep drawing cards until I reach
17 or more.
Do you understand?
Of course, that's so simple. I understand perfectly.

Feel free to go first. You can enjoy yourself for
three rounds or so.

Oh, are you sure? Heheh. Don't be surprised if your
turn never comes around.

We'll need to win six rounds, so I'm pretty sure my
turn will come around...

Well, you wanted to gamble, right? Go ahead and knock
yourself out before the stakes get too high.

Well, aren't you considerate? Fine, I'll do just that.
But don't worry. I have every intention of winning.
Well then, let's begin.

The total is...24?! Bust again?! That's three in a
row. So unlucky...

You're being too greedy. Since your opponent has to
keep drawing until they get over 17, sometimes it's
best to stop drawing cards once you pass 17.

While there is no loss in getting 21, you have to
understand that's not your primary aim.
I'm up next... Deal me in.
Very well... The first card in my hand is an 8.
I have a 5 and 6 for a total of 11...
Hit me.
Here's your third cardâ€”

Queen of Hearts... Face cards are worth 10, so that's
a total of 21.
I have a total of 17... Well played.

It's now one to three with house advantage.
Next round.
Stand. That's a total of 20.
I lose with 19. It's now five to three.
Ack... Four wins in a row! What is going on?!
Why are you upset...?
I'm upset because I'm the only one who lost.

What a selfish thing to say... Anyway, back to the
game... My hand is a total of 20.
Mine is a total of 11. Well, what will you do?

20... She has a solid hand. It only loses to 21.
The dealer also has a pretty good hand, but there's
a chance of busting. You should definitely standâ€”
Hit me.
...Here's your third card.
...An ace. And you?

...16. As I'm under 17, I'll need to draw another
card. That's a total of 24... Bust.
That makes it six to three... The bunny girls win.
I see... So you were counting cards.

Counting cards?! So you were tracking the order of
the cards in the deck! But when...?

She likely has an incredibly keen eye. She must have
watched the cards meticulously in the first three
rounds.

Furthermore, we often use new decks in cases like
this, which can result in a certain amount of bias
due to an insufficient shuffle.

I doubt she knew the exact order, but she could make
decisions based on estimates. She soundly defeated us.
I-I see...

Quite the impressive match. Let's move on to the next
game!
